title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A traditional Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper. Creamy and delicious without using cream!
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook guanciale until crispy, about 8-10 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, both cheeses, and a generous amount of black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water, then drain the pasta.
Add hot pasta to the skillet with guanciale and toss to combine.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in the egg mixture, adding pasta water gradually to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Tender chunks of roasted marinated chicken in a spiced curry sauce. A popular Indian-inspired dish with rich flavors.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken, cut into chunks
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, half the garam masala, cumin, paprika, garlic, and ginger for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large skillet and cook marinated chicken until browned and cooked through. Set aside.
In the same skillet, sauté onions until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add remaining garlic, ginger, and spices. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Stir in cream and return chicken to the pan. Simmer for 5 more minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with cilantro, and serve with rice or naan.

title: Homemade Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies made from scratch. Perfect for dessert or an afternoon snack with milk.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter and both sugars until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.
Gradually blend in the flour mixture until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes or until golden brown around the edges.
Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes before transferring to wire rack.

title: Fresh Garden Salad
summary: A healthy mix of fresh greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, and vegetables. Light, refreshing, and packed with nutrients.
instructions: Wash and thoroughly dry all vegetables.
Tear mixed greens into bite-sized pieces and place in a large salad bowl.
Add diced tomatoes, sliced cucumber, chopped bell pepper, and red onion.
Scatter cherry tomatoes on top.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and Dijon mustard.
Season dressing with salt and pepper to taste.
Drizzle dressing over salad just before serving.
Toss gently to combine and top with feta cheese if desired.

title: Beef Stir Fry with Vegetables
summary: Quick and easy stir-fried beef with colorful vegetables in a savory sauce. Perfect for busy weeknight dinners.
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add remaining oil to the pan and stir-fry vegetables for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch.
Return beef to the pan and add sauce mixture.
Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens and coats everything.
Drizzle with sesame oil and garnish with green onions.
Serve immediately over steamed rice.

title: Blueberry Pancakes
summary: Fluffy pancakes loaded with fresh blueberries. A perfect breakfast treat that's sure to start your day right.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat eggs and whisk in milk, melted butter, and vanilla.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir just until combined (don't overmix).
Gently fold in blueberries.
Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat and brush with butter.
Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake onto the griddle.
Cook until bubbles form on surface and edges look set, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook until golden brown on the other side, 1-2 minutes more.
Serve hot with butter and maple syrup.
